message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

This paper deals with the problem of algorithmic discrimination and proposes a framework for measuring the information content of predictors. The paper also discusses the role of information in fair prediction and how increasing information content through refinements can improve downstream selection rules across a wide range of fairness measures. Given the focus on machine learning and fairness, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
